revised_title: Magnetic Observations on the West Coast of North America
tldr: This article presents the results of magnetic observations conducted by Captain Edward Belcher and his team on the west coast of North America between 1837 and 1840. The observations were made using various magnetic needles, and the data collected was used to determine the horizontal intensity of the Earth's magnetic field at different locations. The findings of this study contributed to the understanding of terrestrial magnetism and its applications in navigation and surveying.
